page.title: 08The Queen goes by.
page.content:
On the fourth of April 1985, the Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh came to Ripon so that the Queen could give the Maundy money to 59 men and 59 women. We waited at the bottom of Claro Road from about half past ten. There was Grandad, Grandma, Dad, Mum, Peter, and me.The car came past at five minutes to eleven. It was very big black car and it had very big windows so that you could get a good view of them.The Queen was dressed in a blue coat and blue hat. When they passed by we waved at them and they waved back at us. After they passed by they went to the Cathedral for the ceremony which started at eleven o clock.
Written by Sharon Dobbins aged 9 years.
